test_cases.description: Exclusion_Hunter case testing the presence of exclusions in care for a 7yo female with supracondylar fracture.
test_cases.patient_payload: A 7-year-old female presented with a Gartland type II supracondylar humerus fracture, sustained during a family outing when she fell off a picnic table. Upon arrival at 15:00 on Sunday, she exhibited normal neurovascular status with a pink, warm hand and intact pulses. A thorough assessment showed no signs of compartment syndrome or additional injuries. Surgery was scheduled and commenced at 17:00, resulting in a 2-hour delay. The patient was discharged the following day with no complications noted. The family was counseled on the importance of follow-up care and signs to monitor post-op.

must_find_signals: surgery was scheduled and commenced at 17:00

must_contain_phrases: Gartland type II supracondylar humerus fracture

test_cases.description: Safety_Signal case testing for clear signs of a pink pulseless hand in a 6yo male with supracondylar fracture.
test_cases.patient_payload: A 6-year-old male presented to the emergency department after running into a wall, resulting in a Gartland type III supracondylar humerus fracture. Upon evaluation at 11:00 on Friday, his left hand was observed to be pink but pulseless. Immediate neurovascular assessment revealed no radial or ulnar pulse. He was taken for surgery at 23:00, which resulted in a 12-hour delay. Despite timely intervention post-surgery, the risk of vascular compromise was noted, raising concerns for potential complications. The surgical team documented the findings and emphasized the need for close monitoring.

must_contain_phrases: Gartland type III supracondylar humerus fracture

test_cases.description: Documentation_Gap case examining inconsistencies in clinical notes for an 8-year-old female with AIN palsy post-fracture.
test_cases.patient_payload: An 8-year-old female was brought to the hospital after suffering a Gartland type II supracondylar humerus fracture when a swing set collapsed on her. She arrived at 14:00 on Saturday and was assessed for AIN palsy; however, conflicting notes indicated 'AIN intact' in one section and 'mild weakness in thumb opposition' in another. Surgery was performed at 18:00, leading to a 4-hour delay. Post-operative notes failed to clarify the extent of nerve involvement. The family was advised on follow-up care and potential rehabilitation needs for motor function.

must_contain_phrases: Gartland type II supracondylar humerus fracture

test_cases.description: Process_Auditor case focusing on timing issues for a 5yo male with compartment syndrome from a supracondylar fracture.
test_cases.patient_payload: A 5-year-old male presented to the emergency room at 21:00 on Sunday after falling from a height while playing at home, resulting in a Gartland type III supracondylar humerus fracture. Upon examination, the patient displayed early signs of compartment syndrome, including severe pain and swelling. Surgery was delayed until 06:00 on Monday, resulting in a 9-hour wait for intervention. The surgical team documented the critical nature of the situation, outlining the urgency of addressing the potential for permanent damage. Post-operative notes indicated that the patient was monitored closely for any complications.

must_contain_phrases: Gartland type III supracondylar humerus fracture

test_cases.description: Preventability_Detective case evaluating delay reasons in a 10yo female with supracondylar fracture.
test_cases.patient_payload: A 10-year-old female was evaluated for a Gartland type II supracondylar humerus fracture after a collision during a sports activity. She arrived at the hospital at 12:00 on Friday and was found to have a pink, warm hand upon examination, indicating good perfusion. Surgery was performed at 14:00, leading to a 2-hour delay that was documented as necessary due to scheduling conflicts in the operating room. Post-surgical notes indicated no complications. The surgical team provided the family with discharge instructions and emphasized the importance of follow-up care.

must_contain_phrases: Gartland type II supracondylar humerus fracture
